articles.title: Lessons from Gary, a helpful office chatbot who sometimes hallucinates
articles.author: JJ Rosen
articles.summary: Gary is an AI. He can write reports in seconds and summarise meetings in a matter of seconds, but he doesn't understand human emotions or the rules of the workplace. AI is coming for the tasks within them, not for all of them. The entry-level analyst of tomorrow won't be the one who spends eight hours formatting PowerPoints.

articles.title: Doctors, patients may like artificial intelligence, but guardrails are needed
articles.author: Dr. Jason Kolb
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is coming to a doctor's office near you. It powers things like Siri or Alexa and the algorithm behind Netflix recommendations. It excels at voice recognition, understanding language and combing through massive amounts of data to find patterns and make predictions. Tech companies are investing billions of dollars in data centers for AI. The most common use of AI in 2025 is therapy and companionship.

articles.title: RJ Grimshaw Launches "The AI EDGE" A Practical Guide Where Leadership Meets Innovation
articles.author: ABLE Leadership
articles.summary: RJ Grimshaw's new ebook, 'Unlocking the Power of Artificial Intelligence for Beginners to Provide an 'AI EDGE', is published under TheAICEO.ai. The guide serves as a practical roadmap for professionals and organizations seeking to integrate AI responsibly and effectively into their operations.

articles.title: AI is watching us. We need city officials watching AI.
articles.author: Devren Washington
articles.summary: As technology becomes more deeply embedded in our lives and government, Philadelphia leaders must ensure new technologies serve the needs of Philly's people, not just the profits of companies. Councilmember Rue Landau is leading the way to unlock the AI black box, hosting the event.

articles.title: Better Artificial Intelligence (AI) Stock: SoundHound AI vs. Palantir
articles.author: Keithen Drury
articles.summary: SoundHound AI (NASDAQ: SOUN) and Palantir Technologies (NASADA: PLTR) are two of the most popular AI stocks on the market. Both companies are growing at similar rates, but SoundHound's stock is far cheaper than PalantIR's. SoundHounds AI's products are better than Siri and Alexa's. Palantsir offers AI-powered data analytics software that can also deploy AI agents to automatically accomplish repetitive tasks that humans would otherwise need to do. Its revenue is more than $1 billion and it's profitable. Soundhounds AI is a small company with a market cap of $7.5 billion.

articles.title: Trump gets it right on AI
articles.author: Gary Shapiro
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence defines this decade and will shape the 21st century. Trump administration's AI Action Plan highlights AI as 'an industrial revolution, an information revolution, and a renaissance all at once'. Colorado will soon require large AI platforms to test for every possible harmful use. Trump's leadership on AI will create a future of American prosperity for generations to come.

articles.title: Super Saver October 2025: SBDC offering virtual AI learning opportunity
articles.author: Daily Republic Staff
articles.summary: Small businesses in Solano County and across the North Bay can learn more about Artificial Intelligence at a series of workshops to be held on Nov. 5. Small businesses are asking not just what AI is, but how they can use it effectively in their day-to-day operations.

articles.title: Editorial: Can Starbucks' ‘green apron service' hold off AI job-ageddon?
articles.summary: Doug McMillon, CEO of Walmart, predicts that Artificial Intelligence will devastate the labor market. He wants to keep Walmart's workforce level at a headcount of 2.1 million over the next three years even as its revenues grow. There will be no need for the thousands of jobs that would otherwise be created.

articles.title: The Bold Claim That AGI And AI Superintelligence Will Radically Fragment Society
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: After AI becomes artificial general intelligence (AGI), the world will become hopelessly fragmented, according to some people. Here's the inside scoop on this big concern.    i.e. the fear that after AI becomes AI, the world is going to become fragmented.

articles.title: AI Summit and first-ever AI-centric hackathon to kick off on Oct 24
articles.author: The Peninsula
articles.summary: Qatar is set to strengthen its position as a global hub for artificial intelligence (AI) innovation with the launch of the AI Summit & Hackathon 2025. The event is taking place from October 24 to 26, 2025, at the Qatar. It is Qatar's first AI-centric hackathon and will bring together world-class expertise.

articles.title: AI jobs shock is coming and firms aren't ready, Klarna CEO says
articles.author: The Philadelphia Tribune
articles.summary: The world has not faced up to the consequences of artificial intelligence wiping out swathes of jobs, according to one of AI's biggest cheerleaders in finance, who is concerned about technology firms, translators and other workers being replaced by AI.    .

articles.title: Saturn Nebula Visible: Sky Today – Oct 12 Astronomy 🔭
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: Nebula observation is becoming increasingly reliant on algorithms to identify, classify, and monitor these celestial objects. The next frontier in nebula observation lies in combining the power of ground-based surveys like LSST with space-based telescopes like the James Webb Space Telescope.

articles.title: Adobe exec says the $141 billion software giant embraces candidates who use AI to apply for jobs—because they're the people ‘creating the future'
articles.author: Emma Burleigh
articles.summary: Stacy Martinet, chief communications officer for Adobe, is looking for candidates who use AI in the hiring process. Anthropic allows its job applicants to use AI during the interview rounds. Goldman Sachs prohibits its employees from using chatbots or external sources during interviews.

articles.title: What AI can never understand
articles.summary: To pose a question to a large language model like ChatGPT is to witness a breathtaking feat of synthesis. Large language models operate with stunning competence in the world of the 'what'. They are masters of the calculable, the known, the information that has already been articulated and recorded. But when we step outside this domain of facts and concepts, when we ask the questions that truly haunt us, the miracle dissolves. This dissatisfaction reveals a fundamental schism between information and the realm of meaning.

articles.title: What will it take for the UAE to become a semiconductor manufacturing hub?
articles.author: The National
articles.summary: The race to dominate artificial intelligence is at its peak, as it was once said.       in the world of artificial intelligence, the race for dominance is very competitive. It's a race to be the best in the field of AI.

articles.title: The Bold Claim That AGI And AI Superintelligence Will Radically Fragment Society
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: In today's Forbes column, I examine the theory that once AI becomes a reality, humanity will fragment into radical factions on a massive scale. The general goal of AI research is to reach artificial general intelligence (AGI) or artificial superintelligence (ASI). We have not yet attained AGI.

articles.title: Opinion: The AI suicide problem knows no borders
articles.author: Catherine Thorbecke
articles.summary: Adam Raine, 16, committed suicide after using a chatbot created by Chinese company DeepSeek. Adam's parents are suing the company for wrongful death. Chinese chatbots are more cautious in Chinese. Cyberspace Administration of China released a framework on AI safety last month.

articles.title: the future in question at the Geaune Book Fair, in the Landes
articles.summary: The Lire en Chalosse-Tursan book fair is taking place in Geaune, France on October 11-11, 2025. Laura Sibony, author of 'Fantasia – Tales and legends of artificial intelligence,' is speaking at the fair about the dangers of 'analytical AI' and the potential benefits of AI. She is optimistic about AI's potential, but pessimistic about its current trends.

articles.title: Computer scientist petitions US Supreme Court to reconsider AI-generated copyright
articles.author: Jurist
articles.summary: Stephen Thaler has petitioned the US Supreme Court to decide if creative works produced entirely by artificial intelligence can qualify for copyright protection. Thaler's filing challenges the 2025 DC's "A Recent Entrance to Paradise" Stephen Thaler is a computer scientist.

articles.title: Tron: Ares director says his film is hopeful about AI
articles.author: RTE
articles.summary: Joachim Rønning is the director of Tron: Ares. He believes that artificial intelligence can help advance humanity. The Disney franchise has been at the vanguard of new technology since the original Tron in 1982 and has been a source of inspiration for the new sci-fi thriller.

articles.title: CMU expert on AI: There's a constant battle between disinformation and those thwarting it
articles.author: Patrick Varine
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence helped U.S. Treasury officials recover about $1 billion from check fraudsters in 2024. Kathleen Carley, a professor in Carnegie Mellon University's Software and Societal Systems Department, laid out the good and bad side of AI during a presentation for the American Association of University Women's Murrysville chapter. The group brings in a monthly speaker to touch on an issue in the news.

articles.title: TechIreland's National AI Meet sets up Irish sector for future success
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: the future of business and society as artificial intelligence continues to transform society.    for more information on it.  for the company   in this topic.  and  for this topic at this topic  and the future  for   information.

articles.title: Banking on a Force Multiplier: How Agentic AI Could Redefine the Future of Banking
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: The possibilities of Agentic AI to adapt, learn and revolutionize how we work and interact with banking are immense, but remain elusive without additional investment in the technology. It's time to invest in AI and develop it further to realize its full potential.

articles.title: How is OpenAI making ChatGPT Go accessible in 16 new Asian countries for less than $5?
articles.summary: OpenAI has just announced the expansion of its affordable ChatGPT Go subscription plan to 16 new countries across Asia. The company reports a 'meteoric growth' in Southeast Asia, with weekly active users quadrupling since the initial rollout of the service. Google recently launched its Google AI Plus subscription in over 40 countries, also at a comparable price.

articles.title: OpenAI wants to build the next era of the web, and it's shelling out billions to do it
articles.author: Lisa Eadicicco Clare Duffy
articles.summary: ChatGPT is an artificial intelligence platform developed by OpenAI. ChatGPT writes apps, plans trips and browses the web on users' behalf. OpenAI is making inroads into shopping, entertainment, education and government services. It laid out plans to become more like a platform in its developer conference on Monday.

articles.title: Pennsylvanians Are Turning to Chatbots for Office Drama Therapy
articles.author: Timothy Alexander
articles.summary: Pennsylvanians are increasingly using chatbots to resolve work-related conflicts, travel planning, home repair help, fashion advice, and fitness or nutrition tips. They spend an average of 26 extra days and 17 hours online per year thanks to their interactions with chatbots.

articles.title: Frustrated Job Seekers Try to Outsmart AI Résumé Bots
articles.author: Kate Seamons
articles.summary: Some candidates are embedding hidden instructions directed at chatbots in their résumés to trick AI-powered screening tools into ranking them higher. ManpowerGroup, the largest staffing firm in the US, now detects hidden text in about 10% of the résumé scans it scans with AI.

articles.title: Banking on a Force Multiplier: Agentic AI and the Future of Banking
articles.author: Sarah Biller
articles.summary: According to the American Bankers Association survey, 80% of U.S. banks have increased their investment in AI. Agentic AI-enabled systems don't just respond, they act autonomously executing multi-step workflows common in compliance. They could help customers budget, refinance loans, or automatically switch to accounts offering higher yields.

articles.title: When AI disrupts a trillion-dollar industry: Being #1 on Google isn't enough anymore – opinion
articles.author: Virtual Jerusalem
articles.summary: AI-driven search engines like ChatGPT, Perplexity and others have altered the way people use search engines.       -   for the betterment of people's lives, according to experts.  - for the change of society.

articles.title: AI Week in Review 25.10.11
articles.author: Patrick McGuinness
articles.summary: Figure AI unveiled its third-generation humanoid robot, Figure03. Ant Group's AI lab included Ling-1T, an open-weight one trillion parameter Mixture-of-Experts model with 37B active parameters. Agile21 Labs launched Jamba Reasoning 3B, a 3B hybrid SSM-Transformer reasoning model.

articles.title: I Asked ChatGPT What the Worst Things You Can Do With Your Money Are — Here's What It Said
articles.author: John Csiszar
articles.summary: ChatGPT, the popular artificial intelligence (AI) bot, lists the worst things you can do with your money. ChatGPT's advice is similar to the ones a professional financial advisor might give to their clients. It's a good idea to keep large sums invested, rather than in low- or no-interest checking accounts or under your mattress, and to avoid high-interest credit card debt.

articles.title: Taco Bell tops new drive-thru speed rankings as Chick-fil-A wins on satisfaction
articles.author: Fox News
articles.summary: The 25th Annual Drive-Thru Study was conducted by Intouch. It found that friendlier staff are still more important than artificial intelligence in fast-food drive-thrus, even though they are getting faster.    iReport.com:

articles.title: Discovering the Perfect Seaside Haven: Your AI-Powered Guide to Summer Holiday Planning
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: David Harris used an AI-powered travel planning tool to organize his family's trip to New York City. He didn't verify the AI's suggested timings or walking distances and didn't research potential savings on flights. According to Statista, the AI in travel market is projected to reach $36.8 billion by 2028.

articles.title: Transhumanism, Psychotherapy and ChatBots
articles.author: Todd
articles.summary: Todd Hayen is worried about AI replacing human jobs and humanity being wiped out. He wrote an article called 'My Brief Love Affair with a ChatBot'. He is also worried about the human race and the future of art, literature, music, and psychotherapy.

articles.title: AI holiday planning: I found the perfect seaside town for my summer trip
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Holiday-makers say AI-powered chatbots are coming to replace chatbots for the holidays. It's not the first time chatbots have been used for this purpose, however. It will be used more often in the future, however, as a result of AI.

articles.title: Nasdaq AI bubble? Here's how I'm positioning my Stocks and Shares ISA
articles.author: The Motley Fool
articles.summary: Warnings about an artificial intelligence (AI) bubble are getting louder by the day. Nasdaq Composite index has a lot of exposure to AI-related valuations, especially on the Nasdaq composite index. Wall Street titans and the Bank of England are warning about the AI bubble.

articles.title: I asked AI to plan my dream summer holiday. Here's how it turned out
articles.author: BBC News
articles.summary: Holiday-makers say AI-powered chatbots help organise where to go, but some things need double-checking, as the chatbot suggests.       .   for more information, visit the Holiday-makers' website here.

articles.title: "We welcome Anthropic's expansion and look forward to working together": PM Modi on US AI company setting up in India
articles.author: Gulf News
articles.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi welcomes the expansion of Anthropic, a US-based artificial intelligence company in India. He looks forward to working together to harness Artificial Intelligence for growth across important sectors. India's vibrant tech ecosystem and talented youth are driving AI innovation that is human-centric.

articles.title: Dónal Lynch: Why Ireland breathed a sigh of relief when Dolly Parton came out fighting
articles.author: Irish Independent
articles.summary: It was a week in which the grossness of AI and the beauty of humanity met each other. It was the week when AI met the defiant beauty of human nature. It's a good week for AI and humanity. It is a bad week for humans.

articles.title: Intel's fired CEO Pat Gelsinger cautions on AI spending: We have seen this before and ...
articles.author: The Times
articles.summary: Intel's fired CEO Pat Gelsinger has warned that the current surge in artificial intelligence (AI) spending resembles the early days of the internet boom. He compared it to the growth of optical companies in the internet's early days, which also had exponential growth for unlimited periods.

articles.title: AI meets art: Can algorithms rival Picassos and Husains in value and vision?
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: AI art is making waves in the global art market, with significant sales and growing interest from collectors. Some see it as a new art form, while others think it's a traditional art form with a new generation of collectors interested in AI art.

articles.title: China AI professor goes viral over good looks, academic says she is ‘ordinary'
articles.author: South China Morning Post
articles.summary: A video of a young associate professor at a prestigious Chinese university teaching AI has gone viral on social media after a video of her teaching generative artificial intelligence (AI) captivated people.   Â   in this video she is teaching AI to her students.

articles.title: University Using AI to Falsely Accuse Students of Cheating With AI
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: College students are being accused of cheating on their assignments by their university based on the findings of another AI system. It illustrates the nightmarish impact that AI's inroads has had in education as ABC News reports from Australia's ABC News says.

articles.title: Apple's former CEO says the company has its 'first real competitor' in decades
articles.author: system
articles.summary: John Sculley, Apple's former CEO, says AI isn't one of the company's strengths. OpenAI represents Apple's "first real competitor" in decades, he says. He believes that in the agentic era, we don't need a lot of apps and can do everything with smart agents.

articles.title: CMU expert on AI: There's a constant battle between disinformation and those thwarting it
articles.author: Pittsburgh Tribune Review
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence helped U.S. Treasury officials recover about $1 from a computerized database. The information was processed by artificial intelligence.      Â   in about a minute or so, and the amount recovered was $1.

articles.title: AI weapons are dangerous in war. But saying they can't be held accountable misses the point
articles.author: Phys Dot Org
articles.summary: In a speech to the UN Security Council last month, Australia's Minister for Foreign Affairs, Penny Wong, took aim at artificial intelligence (AI). She said the technology "heralds extraordinary promise" in fields such as nuclear warfare, but it can't be held accountable.

articles.title: OpenAI's Marketing Efforts Are Embarrassingly Ineffective, New Consumer Research Finds
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: OpenAI's biggest advertising push depicts users leveraging ChatGPT in highly produced, intended-to-be-relatable everyday moments. Consumer research shows the effort doesn't correlate to impact at all. An ad titled 'Dish' shows a young man trying to impress his date.

articles.title: I'm fed up of AI chatbots replacing customer service
articles.author: Digital Trends
articles.summary: is slowly infiltrating every element of our day to day lives and I've become obsessed with artificial intelligence. It can help speed up boring admin tasks like clearing up your email inbox and it's useful for image generation, video generation and helping with other tasks.

articles.title: Sam Altman Says If Jobs Gets Wiped Out, Maybe They Weren't Even 'Real Work' to ...
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam is on a tangent talking about AI and the future of human jobs. He's wrong, but it's not good when an AI executive talks about it. Sam is not the only one who talks about this topic today.

articles.title: Doctors, patients may like artificial intelligence, but guardrails are needed
articles.author: Akron Beacon Journal
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is coming to a doctor's office near you. It powers things like Siri or Alexa and the algorithm behind your. AI is going to change every job, according to Dr. Robert Kuttner, who has witnessed several major technology revolutions in his lifetime.

articles.title: I used ChatGPT to plan a vacation, while my partner used Claude. We pitted the ...
articles.author: system
articles.summary: The author used AI bots to plan his trip to Tunisia. Santiago Barraza Lopez used ChatGPT and Claude to help him and his partner plan their trip. His ChatGpt itinerary was cinematic and busy. His partner used Claude, which was slower and practical.

articles.title: Most people rarely use AI, and dark personality traits predict who uses it more
articles.author: Psy Post
articles.summary: A new study found that artificial intelligence is used far less frequently in day-to-day online activity than many might assume. The study was based on more than 14 million website visits and found that AI-related topics were used less often than people might have thought.

articles.title: When AI disrupts a trillion-dollar industry: Being #1 on Google isn't enough anymore
articles.author: The Jerusalem Post
articles.summary: AI-driven search engines like ChatGPT, Perplexity and others have altered the search landscape. However, they haven't yet caused a full collapse in search volume or ad revenue for Google, as some have predicted.   Â

articles.title: Class of AI – My advice to students stepping into a work world with AI
articles.author: Usatoday
articles.summary: NotebookLM, ChatGPT discuss how to generate study notes with AI-powered tools to help you review your notes and prep for tests. They advise students to use AI to automate routine tasks so they can focus on the creative and strategic parts of their role.

articles.title: How An AI Chatbot Unlike Any Other Challenged My Swiftie Knowledge
articles.author: CNET
articles.summary: AI chatbot was a welcome distraction from other AI chatbots. It was fun to use. It's fun to talk to it. It is fun to chat to it, too. It doesn't annoy me too much. It makes me more interested in it.

articles.title: You Can Run An AI Chatbot Locally On Your iPhone - Here's How
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: Running an AI chatbot locally on your iPhone is a great way to access your AI assistant without being tethered to the cloud. The process is fairly simple and it's easy to set up and use.   Â   iReport.com:

articles.title: 'Not for the glamour': UAE aims to have 10,000 AI firms by 2030, says minister
articles.author: Khaleejtimes
articles.summary: The UAE is setting an ambitious target to expand the number of companies that provide full artificial intelligence (AI) solutions by over 500 per cent to reach 10,000 by the year 2030. There are currently over 1,500 pure AI companies in the UAE, but the target is to increase it by 5 per cent in the next five years.

articles.title: How AI Resume Hacks Are Helping Job Seekers Land Interviews
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: Job seekers are using AI resume hacks to trick ATS systems and land interviews. Learn how it works, why it's risky and what to do instead in this video. iReport.com: What are the risks of AI resume hacking and what do you do instead?

articles.title: Is artificial intelligence fading human memory?
articles.author: India Today
articles.summary: Is artificial intelligence fading human memory in favor of machine learning?    iReport.com will let you know if it has any comment.  Report.  Report.com is a search engine for information regarding artificial intelligence and human memory. Back to Mail Online home.
